Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: epidemiology \ep`i*de`mi*ol"o*gy\, n. [Epidemy + -logy.] (Med.) That branch of medicine which studies the incidence and distribution of disease in a population, and uses such information to find the causes, modes of transmission, and methods for control of disease. [1913 Webster +PJC]
epidemiology n : the branch of medical science dealing with the transmission and control of disease
